intro: Oreodaphne strumosa, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain hard, dark seeds. It is often found in lowland and montane forests, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic and practical properties.
